data.title: Quentin Tarantino: Movies, Photos, Videos, News, Biography & Birthday
data.meta_description: Quentin Tarantino: Check out the list of all Quentin Tarantino movies along with photos, videos, biography and birthday. Also find latest Quentin Tarantino news on Times of India.
data.text:
2024 Academy Museum Gala to honour Rita Moreno, Quentin Tarantino, more A-listers

ANI / Jun 11, 2024, 17:10 (IST)

The Academy Museum in Los Angeles will host its fourth annual gala on October 19, celebrating the cinematic achievements of Paul Mescal, Rita Moreno, and Quentin Tarantino. This fundraising event, marking the museum's third anniversary, aims to gather support for exhibitions, educational programs, and public initiatives. Paul Mescal will receive the Vantage Award for challenging cinematic norms, while Rita Moreno will be honored with the Icon Award for her global cultural impact. Quentin Tarantino will be recognized with the Luminary Award for his creative contributions to film. Co-chaired by prominent figures like Dr. Eric Esrailian and Salma Hayek Pinault, the gala is supported by Rolex. Incoming museum director Amy Homma expressed enthusiasm for the event, highlighting its celebration of cinema's power. Last year's gala raised over USD 10 million and featured esteemed guests like Meryl Streep and Oprah Winfrey. The 2024 Host Committee includes industry icons like Tom Hanks and emerging talents like Yahya Abdul-Mateen II, reflecting the event's significance in the film community.

Maya Hawke admits she bagged 'Once Upon a Time in Hollywood' due to 'nepotistic reasons'

PTI / Jun 02, 2024, 18:18 (IST)

Maya Hawke, known for her role in "Stranger Things", acknowledges her parentage played a role in landing her a part in Quentin Tarantino's "Once Upon a Time... in Hollywood". Despite her debut in "Ladyworld", Maya's role as Flowerchild in Tarantino's film garnered attention, along with her work in "Stranger Things". Addressing accusations of nepotism, Maya admits her family connections likely influenced her casting. However, she embraces the opportunity, acknowledging the complexity of the concept of "deserving". Despite facing criticism, Maya asserts her comfort with her privilege and intends to make the most of it.

Chris Hemsworth responds to critics of MCU movies

etimes.in / May 15, 2024, 12:28 (IST)

Chris Hemsworth, renowned for his portrayal of Thor in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU), recently defended superhero films against criticism from directors like Martin Scorsese and Quentin Tarantino. He pointed out that even esteemed directors have had movies that didn't resonate with audiences, questioning the validity of their critiques. Hemsworth emphasized the immense popularity of superhero movies worldwide, highlighting the significance of the billions who enjoy them. Reflecting on his performance in 'Thor: Love and Thunder,' Hemsworth admitted to immersing himself in its improvisational and humorous aspects, contributing to its success. Despite feeling he could've improved, he acknowledged becoming a caricature of his character.

Quentin Tarantino backs away from 'The Movie Critic'

ANI / Apr 18, 2024, 16:46 (IST)

Quentin Tarantino's surprising departure from the much-anticipated film, 'The Movie Critic,' has left fans intrigued and puzzled. Initially envisioned as a nostalgic tribute to his 1970s California upbringing, the project aimed to explore Hollywood's gritty side through the eyes of a disillusioned critic, with the potential return of Brad Pitt as Cliff Booth adding to its allure. However, as development progressed, Tarantino's evolving creative direction and challenges securing studio support cast uncertainty over the project's fate. Hindered by the inability to secure a California Tax Credit and wavering studio interest, 'The Movie Critic' faced obstacles reminiscent of Tarantino's abandoned 'Star Trek' concept. Despite the setback, Tarantino's resolve to retire after his tenth film underscores the significance of this project, heightening anticipation among fans and critics alike. Meanwhile, his venture into literature with the novelization of 'Once Upon a Time in Hollywood' offers fresh insights into his acclaimed work, showcasing his multifaceted talent.

Brad Pitt in talks to join Quentin Tarantino's 'The Movie Critic'

ANI / Feb 03, 2024, 11:24 (IST)

Brad Pitt is likely to reunite with Quentin Tarantino for 'The Movie Critic', Tarantino's tenth and final film. The film is set in 1970s southern California and is inspired by the life of film critic Pauline Kael. Pitt and Tarantino previously collaborated on 'Inglourious Basterds' and 'Once Upon a Time... in Hollywood', with Pitt winning an Oscar for the latter.

The Movie Critic: Quentin Tarantino to reunite with Brad Pitt for last movie

etimes.in / Feb 02, 2024, 10:07 (IST)

Brad Pitt to join Quentin Tarantino for his final film 'The Movie Critic' set in 1977 LA. Tarantino seeks a fresh face in their fourth collaboration. Pitt's involvement not confirmed due to packed schedule. Quentin's last project. Tarantino and Pitt's previous works: 'True Romance,' 'Inglourious Basterds,' 'Once Upon a Time in Hollywood.'

Ananya Pandey wants to work in Quentin Tarantino's 'last film'

IANS / Dec 03, 2023, 12:34 (IST)

Ananya Pandey has expressed her desire to work with maverick filmmaker Quentin Tarantino and said that she has to be in his "last film". The Bollywood actress also said that she wants to work with director Sanjay Leela Bhansali in India.

Ananya Panday dreams of collaborating with Sanjay Leela Bhansali and Quentin Tarantino

etimes.in / Dec 02, 2023, 11:47 (IST)

Ananya Panday represented India at the Red Sea International Film Festival in Jeddah, where she credited filmmaker Karan Johar for inspiring her entry into acting. She expressed her desire to work with renowned directors like Sanjay Leela Bhansali and Quentin Tarantino. Ananya also revealed her interest in the medical field and teaching preschoolers. She is currently preparing for the release of 'Kho Gaye Hum Kahan,' a film about friendship set in Mumbai, co-written by Arjun Varain Singh, Zoya Akhtar, and Reema Kagti, which will premiere on Netflix on December 26, 2023.

Quentin Tarantino visits southern Israeli base to boost IDF morale

ANI / Oct 14, 2023, 11:05 (IST)

Filmmaker Quentin Tarantino visited an Israeli base in southern Israel to boost the morale of the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) during the ongoing war with the Hamas terror group. Tarantino, who has been living in Tel Aviv for the past two years with his Israeli wife and children, posed for pictures with troops in front of an airplane and the Israeli flag. The conflict between Israel and Hamas has entered its eighth day, with a high death toll and ongoing efforts to identify and return bodies. International efforts for de-escalation and lasting peace continue.

Linda Haynes, whose 'Rolling Thunder' role inspired Tarantino, dies at 75

IANS / Aug 13, 2023, 17:43 (IST)

Linda Haynes, best known for her roles in Brubaker, Rolling Thunder and Human Experiments, has died in her sleep at the age of 75, according to her son. Haynes, whose acting had a major influence on Quentin Tarantino, largely starred in crime thrillers and neo-noir films from the 1970s and 80s. Despite making a huge impression on Hollywood, she disappeared from the acting scene mysteriously.

Did you know: Ram Alladi’s ‘Panne’ aka ‘PAGES’ has an interesting connection to Quentin Tarantino?

etimes.in / May 23, 2023, 09:58 (IST)

Filmmaker Ram Alladi's latest political drama 'Panne aka PAGES' was influenced by Quentin Tarantino's directing techniques, primarily non-linear storytelling and trailer cutting. Alladi believes that Tarantino's style of filmmaking, packed with references from classic cinema, influences filmmakers to take creative risks. For narration in his new film, Alladi enlisted the services of actors Naseeruddin Shah, Anupam Kher or Danny Denzongpa to add an additional layer of complexity to the story. 'Panne aka PAGES' will be released earlier this year.
